title: Decision Documentation
content: Document significant decisions: what you decided, why, what alternatives you considered, and what information you had. Documentation enables learning, protects against hindsight bias, and allows others to understand your reasoning. When reviewing decisions later, documentation shows what was known at the time versus what was learned after.

mcq.question: A decision you made is being reviewed after a bad outcome. You didn't document your reasoning at the time. What's the risk?

options.A: You'll have to rely on memory
options.B: Hindsight bias will make the decision appear worse than it was given information available
options.D: You should have consulted more people

mcq.explanation: Without documentation, reviewers evaluate with full hindsight while you made the decision with limited information. Documentation captures what you knew and considered at decision time.

openQuestions: What decisions do you document? What should you document that you don't?
How would documentation have helped explain a past decision?
